results.name: Number T(n,k) of colored integer partitions of n using all colors of a k-set such that a color pattern for part i has i distinct colors in increasing order; triangle T(n,k), n>=0, 0<=k<=n, read by rows.
comment: The sequence of column k satisfies a linear recurrence with constant coefficients of order k*2^(k-1) = A001787(k).
link: Alois P. Heinz, Rows n = 0..140, flattened
maple: b:= proc(n, i, k) option remember; `if`(n=0, 1, `if`(i<1, 0, add(
mathematica: b[n_, i_, k_] := b[n, i, k] = If[n == 0, 1, If[i<1, 0, Sum[b[n - i j, Min[n - i j, i - 1], k] Binomial[Binomial[k, i] + j - 1, j], {j, 0, n/i}]]];
T[n_, k_] := Sum[b[n, n, i] (-1)^(k - i) Binomial[k, i], {i, 0, k}];
Table[T[n, k], {n, 0, 12}, {k, 0, n}] // Flatten (* _Jean-François Alcover_, Oct 04 2019, after _Alois P. Heinz_ *)
